response:
Left-lower-limb–predominant UMN syndrome (spasticity, brisk knee/ankle reflexes, extensor plantar) with no cranial nerve signs localises contralaterally to the medial leg area of the motor cortex. Concurrent distal symmetric loss of vibration/proprioception with positive Romberg indicates a separate large‑fiber, length‑dependent peripheral neuropathy causing sensory ataxia.

lesion_locations = ["right medial precentral gyrus", "bilateral length-dependent peripheral polyneuropathy"]
